SENT.plain: We describe the clinical and cerebral ultrasonographic features of a rare case of type 1 acrocephalosyndactyly (Apert syndrome)
The patient was a newborn male whose twin had died in utero
Most cases of Apert syndrome are sporadic, although autosomal dominant inheritance has also been reported
Diagnosis is based on physical examination together with imaging data
Since Apert syndrome can give rise to numerous CNS abnormalities, affected newborns should undergo echoencephalography for more complete characterization of their malformations
